alert.note: Alert for Iron (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 6:57AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Iron County through 630 AM CDT... At 556 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout near Tipler, or 11 miles southwest of Iron River, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 40 mph, and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Stambaugh around 610 AM CDT. Iron River around 615 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Amasa. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
